title: Debug: Data Type Issues
story: String numbers can't be summed! dtype mismatches are a common source of bugs. Learn to convert types properly.
instructions: Fix the code that tries to sum string numbers. Convert the 'amount' column to numeric type first, then calculate the sum.
starterCode:
import pandas as pd

df = pd.DataFrame({
    'item': ['A', 'B', 'C'],
    'amount': ['100', '200', '300']  # Strings, not numbers!
})

# BUGGY: Can't sum strings
total = df['amount'].sum()
print(total)
solutionHidden:
import pandas as pd

df = pd.DataFrame({
    'item': ['A', 'B', 'C'],
    'amount': ['100', '200', '300']
})

# FIXED: Convert to numeric first
df['amount'] = pd.to_numeric(df['amount'])
total = df['amount'].sum()
print(total)

tests.expectedBehavior: Convert strings to numbers and sum

hints.text: Use pd.to_numeric() to convert string numbers to actual numeric type.
df['amount'] = pd.to_numeric(df['amount']) converts the column, then sum() works.
